intro: Cruciata glabra f. halleri, commonly known as the Halleri form of the smooth cruciata, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes, and its simple, alternate leaves with a smooth surface. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in grasslands or along stream banks. It is a perennial herb that produces small, rounded fruits known as siliques. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
